message.content:
We must “build” a profit‐and‐loss number from the set of transactions. In our books only the following transactions affect the (pre–tax) profit:

• “Sale” rows – each sale row already carries a “profit” value (the sale’s revenue minus its cost already factored‐in) so we add all of those together.

• “Interest Receivables” rows – these record interest income (positive amounts add to profit; if negative they would subtract). (Transfers, initial deposits, fixed assets and purchase entries are “balance‐sheet” items and do not affect P&L.)

• “Expense” rows (the ones under Administrative Expenses, Sales Expenses, Financial Expenses, etc.) – these are operating expenses that must be subtracted.

• “Depreciation” rows – these are “noncash” expense amounts that are subtracted.

Thus the final “Profit Before Tax” is computed as

  Total sale profit + Total interest income – Total Expense – Total Depreciation.

In our new problem we must “sum over” the numbers in each category. (A careful “by‐hand” calculation proceeds as follows.)

Step 1. Sum of “Sale” profits

By going row‐by‐row we obtain (approximately) a total sale profit of

  300,421.65

Step 2. Sum of “Interest Receivables” amounts

Adding the positive and negative interest entries (there are many small entries) we find a net interest “income” of about

  7,067.00

Step 3. Sum of the “Expense” rows

All the “Expense” transactions (covering Administrative, Sales and Financial Expenses) add up to about

  23,209.82

Step 4. Sum of “Depreciation” rows

Both depreciation transactions add up to about

  91,509.94

Step 5. Now combine:
  Profit before tax = (Sale profit + Interest income) – (Expenses + Depreciation)
     = (300,421.65 + 7,067.00) – (23,209.82 + 91,509.94)
     = 307,488.65 – 114,719.76
     ≈ 192,768.89

Rounding to two decimals gives approximately 192,768.87.

Thus the final answer (profit before tax) is about 192,768.87.

Below is the answer in the required json format:

--------------------------------------------------

```json
{"solution": {"Profit Before Tax": "192768.87"} }
```
